intro: Sida andicola, commonly known as the Andean sida, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture. Sida andicola produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
